poem:
Blueprints of Silence

In cautious corridors,   
whispered steps betray,   
a leader's dance –  
not with destiny,  
but shadows of delay.   

History holds its breath,   
waiting, undeterred,  
while ambitions tread light  
where echoes  
are barely heard.  

A tapestry of chance,  
woven thin,  
by hands afraid to win.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on Labour’s first year in power: crisis reveals the cost of caution | Editorial “Nothing is inevitable until it happens,” wrote AJP Taylor, rejecting the idea that history unfolds according to a plan. Taylor distrusted grand visions. Sir Keir Starmer seems afraid to have one. A year into power, the prime minister doesn’t act like a man chosen by history, but one hoping to avoid its glare. Modern politics shifts quickly and governing". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Guardian view on Labour’s first year in power: crisis reveals the cost of caution | Editorial “Nothing is inevitable until it happens,” wrote AJP Taylor, rejecting the idea that history unfolds according to a plan. Taylor distrusted grand visions. Sir Keir Starmer seems afraid to have one. A year into power, the prime minister doesn’t act like a man chosen by history, but one hoping to avoid its glare. Modern politics shifts quickly and governing
